description.narrative: The Somalia Resilience Program (SomReP) is one of a number of resilience programs aimed at building the resilience of vulnerable populations in Somalia to withstand recurrent shocks (such as drought, flood, conflict). The program is being implemented by a coalition of key international non-government organisations working in some of the most difficult areas of Somalia, many of which have recently emerged from Al-Shabaab control. SomReP works to assist local communities rebuild and improve the quality and value of productive assets (livestock, seeds, tools) as a means of increasing food security, stimulating markets, increasing local incomes. The aim is to help people become self-sufficient and reduce their need for continued humanitarian assistance. Australian assistance will support work in three districts, through World Vision, Oxfam, and Action Against Hunger (ACF). The funding will be used to: strengthen community livelihoods by increasing household productive assets (livestock,
